page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: The village developed irregularly along the road, from 12th century farm houses through quarry & rail eras to present day private bungalows & council house block. There are 4 large houses. Slate is the main building material. 41 homes are permanently occupied 3 of which are for sale. 27 homes are owner occupied. 14 holiday homes. 15 council homes 2 of which now owned by previous tenants. 28 caravans 2 Chapels, 1 educational establishment for Liverpool children. 7 farms all farmed by owners. There are numbers on terraces otherwise houses are known by their Welsh names. There is all night street lighting every 30 metres in the Gwynedd side of the village.
